result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose M. Maldonado Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be served concurrent to 16CM119.  In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.  Court orders court costs and DNA surcharge be waived.  Defendant to submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose M. Maldonado Cruz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Jose M. Maldonado Cruz in court with attorney Steve Laxton.  John Harrison Sacia appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter F.F. appears in person.  Def wishes to enter plea, defense files plea questionnaire.  Court advises rights, court finds defendant KVI waives rights and accepts plea.  Complaint used as factual basis and court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant sentenced.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jose M. Maldonado Cruz in court with attorney Steve Laxton.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PLEAS set, bond cont.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
